entries.meaning: (botany, now uncommon) Having the throat of a corolla nearly closed by a projection of the base of the lower lip (in a way reminiscent of a mask), as in the flower of the snapdragon.
examples: This arrangement is well typified in plants with a personate corolla, such as the toad-flax and snap-dragon, ...

verbs.description: personate (third-person singular simple present personates, present participle personating, simple past and past participle personated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fraudulently portray another person; to impersonate.
examples: But this latter has, at the suggestion of Tyndarus, exchanged clothes with him, and the slave […]  personates the master.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To portray a character (as in a play); to act.
(transitive) To attribute personal characteristics to something; to personify.
(transitive) To set forth in an unreal character; to disguise; to mask.

verbs.description: personate (third-person singular simple present personates, present participle personating, simple past and past participle personated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To celebrate loudly; to extol; to praise.
